channel.title: Help on this code

item.title: Help on this code
item.dc:creator: @darkness2288 darkness2288
item.description:
@darkness2288 wrote:

i did it it looks like this now but it still wont work arrggghhh!!

[code] if (objectID == 2117) { //search = open (wall = closed)
if ((objectX == 2875 && objectY == 9799)) {
face = 0; //West
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 2623) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2924 && objectY == 9803)) {
face = -2; //North
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 1558) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2898 && objectY == 9832)) {
face = -1; //North
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 1557) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2898 && objectY == 9831)) {
face = -3; //South
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 1542) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2892 && objectY == 9826)) {
face = 0; //West
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 1544) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2893 && objectY == 9826)) {
face = -2; //East
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 2143) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2889 && objectY == 9831)) {
face = -1; //North
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -3);
}
else if (objectID == 2144) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2889 && objectY == 9830)) {
face = -3; //South
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), -1);
}

if ((objectID == 9293) && (objectX == 2887) && (objectY == 9799)) //pipe1 in tav dungeon
{
sendMessage(“You crawl through the small pipe…”);
sendMessage(“You come out at the blue dragons!.”);
teleportToX = 2892;
teleportToY = 9799;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help on this code
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Change the -2 to an odd number (In your case -3 or -1 --But it doesnt matter which of those)

All youve done is rotate the door 180 degrees, so it looks the same.

Read full topic

item.description:

[code]if (objectID == 2117) { //search = open (wall = closed)
if ((objectX == 2875 && objectY == 9799)) {

item.title: Help on this code
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

easy it means that the integers (replaceobject) cannot be used with the variable in paraentheses. So in other words, your not using the “replaceobject” codes correctly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @darkness2288 darkness2288
item.description:
@darkness2288 wrote:

here’s the errors

client.java:19350: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19356: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19362: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19368: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19374: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19380: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19386: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ client.java:19392: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectI D + 1), face,0); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 8 errors ---|-Enabled-| --- [br][size=1]Posted at: November 04, 2006, 01:48:47 AM[/size][hr]someone?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 04, 2006, 02:54:52 AM[/size][hr]man anyone at least tell me whats wrong?

item.description:
@darkness2288 wrote:

here’s the door code they hade

[code] if (objectID == 2117) { //search = open (wall = closed)
if ((objectX == 2875 && objectY == 9799)) {
face = 0; //West
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), face,0);
}
else if (objectID == 2623) { //open = open (gate = closed)
if ((objectX == 2924 && objectY == 9803)) {
face = -2; //North
}//else = West (standard)
ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID + 1), face,0);
}
else if (objectID == 1558) { //open = open (gate = closed)

face = -3; //South
}//else = West (standard)

}
